title: Bant (Omdurman)
text:
Bant ( / <a href="Romanization%20of%20Arabic">transliterated</a>: ) is an affluent district in <a href="Omdurman">Omdurman</a> <a href="city">city</a>, <a href="Khartoum%20State">Khartoum State</a>, <a href="Sudan">Sudan</a>. south-western part of the ancient <a href="city">city</a> of <a href="Omdurman">Omdurman</a>.
Geography.
Borders of Bant, from the <a href="east">east</a> by Almorada Street, a <a href="two-way%20street">two-way street</a> extends from north to south, and Alarbeen Street which extends from <a href="north">north</a> to <a href="south">south</a> divided the district into Bant East and Bant West. It is bordered on the <a href="south">south</a> by Alawda street adjacent to the military area, and form the north Abukdok and officers district . Its borders ended at Almutamer Secondary School for boys Corner.
History.
Although the district is one of the Urban of the new <a href="residential">residential</a> districts, but it was founded in the late <a href="1940-1949">1940s</a> and early <a href="1950-1959">1950s</a> of the past <a href="century">century</a> after the central government distributed plots of land to the <a href="population">population</a> of Almorda district, as compensation for what they had lost as a result of <a href="residential">residential</a> land in <a href="Architectural%20planning">Architectural planning</a> processes in the Postal area and Almorda <a href="Street">Street</a>.

Climate.
Bant features a hot <a href="desert%20climate">desert climate</a>, with only the <a href="month">month</a>s of July and August seeing significant precipitation. Bant averages a little over of precipitation per year.
